Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hound’s head in outline, to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as in the Mature Animal Style, however, hounds are very rare on vases of this style and the lack of interior decoration suggests that the sherd may be earlier and in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 256, no. 455, pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0160) (phase 2)
